title: Chromatin compaction classification using DAPI intensity
code: setRepositories(ind=c(1,2)) install.packages("nucim")

what: code to classify one rgb image
title: Chromatin compaction classification using DAPI intensity
text: choose RGB file number slices need dimensions image microns dimensions voxel assume third channel blue, ie, DAPI mask kernel classify DAPI channel count voxel per class percentages
code: library(bioimagetools) library(nucim) img = readTIF(file.choose()) slices = dim(img)[4] x = attributes(img)$x.resolution y = attributes(img)$y.resolution z = as.numeric(attributes(img)$spacing) * slices X = x/dim(img)[1] Y = y/dim(img)[2] Z = as.numeric(attributes(img)$spacing) zscale=mean(c(X,Y))/Z blue = img[,,3,] mask = dapimask(blue, c(x,y,z), thresh="auto") classes = classify(blue, mask, 7, z=zscale) counts <- table.n(classes, 7) perc <- print(counts/sum(counts)*100, 1) barplot(perc, names.arg=1:7, xlab="DAPI intensity class", ylab="percentage")

what: code to classify a folder full of rgb images
title: Chromatin compaction classification using DAPI intensity
text: choose one files folder RGB files scripts can use parallel computing, available (Windows) split channels masks classification results folders “class7” “class7-n”
code: library(bioimagetools) library(nucim) folder = file.choose() f = unlist(gregexpr("/",folder)) folder = substr(folder,1,f[length(f)]) nr.cores=ifelse(.Platform$OS.type=="windows", 1, 4) splitchannels.folder(folder, rgb.folder="./", cores=nr.cores) dapimask.folder(folder, cores=nr.cores) classify.folder(folder, 7, cores=nr.cores)

title: Workflow
text: Install nucim using install.packages(). package relies EBImage package, available bioconductor, hence need set repositories accordingly: Start loading necessary libraries:
code: setRepositories(ind=c(1,2)) install.packages("nucim") library(bioimagetools) library(nucim)

what: Read image and mask from DAPI
title: Workflow
text: following, use example dataset available online. Use readTIF function bioimagetools load RGB image. dapimask function automatically finds kernel using DAPI (blue) channel. takes 30 seconds (computation times using MacBookPro 2019, 2,4 GhZ Quad-Core i5, 16 GB RAM)
code: img = readTIF("http://ex.volkerschmid.de/cell.tif") sections = dim(img)[4] x = y = 0.0395 z = 0.125 blue = img[,,3,] mask = dapimask(blue, c(x,y,z)*dim(img)[1:3], thresh="auto") ## 0 o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o .

title: Workflow
text: Next find compaction classes DAPI channel (Computation time around 180 sec.). Barplot classes heatmap, finally save classes image.
code: classes = classify(blue, mask, 7, beta=0.1, z=x/z) ## 0 o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 tab<-table.n(classes, 7, percentage=TRUE) barplot(tab, ylab="percentage", xlab="chromatin compaction level",col=heatmap7()) par(pty="s") img(classes, z=16, col=heatmap7(), mask=mask) writeTIF(classes, "classes.tif") ## [1] 52

title: Workflow
text: Find distances compaction classes (computation time around 480 seconds, due parallelization depends number cores). plotting function defines mean distance: minimum distance class voxels, quantile plot boxplot.
code: classes<-readClassTIF("classes.tif") distances = nearestClassDistances(classes,  voxelsize=c(x,y,z), classes=7, cores=4L) save(distances,file="distances.Rdata") plotNearestClassDistances(distances, method="min",ylim=c(0,.1),qu=.01) plotNearestClassDistances(distances, method="quantile",ylim=c(0,.22),qu=.01) plotNearestClassDistances(distances, method="boxplot",ylim=c(0,1.5))

title: Workflow
text: can compute distribution color channels compaction classes. use threshold approach intensity-weighted approach comparison. test independence color channels compaction classes automatically done (computation time around 4 sec.).   Alternatively, can find spots first use find distribution compaction classes (computation time spots() around 90 sec.).
code: red = img[,,1,] green = img[,,2,] cc1<-colors.in.classes(classes,red,green,mask,7,type="thresh",plot=TRUE,                        col1="red",col2="green",thresh1=0.05,thresh2=0.05,                        test="Wilcoxon",ylim=c(0,.5),                        xlab="chromatin compaction levels",ylab="percentage") ## Wilcoxon rank-sum test DAPI vs. channel 1: p-value < 5e-09 ## Wilcoxon rank-sum test DAPI vs. channel 2: p-value < 5e-09 ## Wilcoxon rank-sum test channel 1 vs. channel 2: p-value = 0.00021042 cc2<-colors.in.classes(classes,red,green,mask,7,type="intensity",plot=TRUE,                        col1="red",col2="green",thresh1=0.05,thresh2=0.05,                        test="Wilcoxon",ylim=c(0,.5),                        xlab="chromatin compaction levels",ylab="percentage") ## Wilcoxon rank-sum test DAPI vs. channel 1: p-value < 5e-09 ## Wilcoxon rank-sum test DAPI vs. channel 2: p-value < 5e-09 ## Wilcoxon rank-sum test channel 1 vs. channel 2: p-value = 0.00362231 system.time({ spots<-spots.combined(red=red,green=green,mask=mask,size=c(x,y,z),                       full.voxel=FALSE,thresh.offset=0.05) }) ## 0 o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x .0 o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o 0 o . x X x . o ##    user  system elapsed  ##  39.961   7.943  48.806 cc<-colors.in.classes(classes,spots$red,spots$green,mask,7,type="i",plot=TRUE,                       col1="red",col2="green",test="Wilcoxon",ylim=c(0,.8),                       xlab="chromatin compaction levels",ylab="percentage") ## Wilcoxon rank-sum test DAPI vs. channel 1: p-value < 5e-09 ## Wilcoxon rank-sum test DAPI vs. channel 2: p-value < 5e-09 ## Wilcoxon rank-sum test channel 1 vs. channel 2: p-value = 6.801e-05

title: Workflow on a folder
code: setRepositories(ind=c(1,2)) install.packages("nucim") library(bioimagetools) library(nucim)

title: Workflow on a folder
text: choose one files folder RGB files scripts can use parallel computing, available (Windows) split channels masks classification results folders “class7” “class7-n” class distances colors classes Works also contiguous targeted sequences
code: folder = folder.choose() nr.cores=ifelse(.Platform$OS.type=="windows", 1, parallel::detectCores()) splitchannels.folder(folder, rgb.folder="./", cores=nr.cores) dapimask.folder(folder, voxelsize=c(0.0395,0.0395,0.125), cores=nr.cores) classify.folder(folder, 7, cores=nr.cores) plot_classify.folder(folder, 7, cores=nr.cores, col=heatmap7()) nearestClassDistances.folder(folder, voxelsize=c(0.0395,0.0395,0.125), cores=nr.cores) plot_nearestClassDistances.folder(folder, cores=nr.cores) colors.in.classes.folder(folder, "green", color2="red", cores=nr.cores, thresh1=0.05, thresh2=0.05, type="intensity") plot_colors.in.classes.folder(folder,"green","red") t_colors.in.classes.folder(folder,test="wilcox") spots.combined.folder(folder, cores=nr.cores, thresh.offset=0.02, full.voxel=FALSE) colors.in.classes.folder(folder, "markers_red", color2="markers_green", cores=nr.cores,type="i") plot_colors.in.classes.folder(folder,"red","green") t_colors.in.classes.folder(folder,test="wilcox")

title: Authors and Citation
text: Volker Schmid. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Volker J. Schmid, Marion Cremer, Thomas Cremer. Quantitative analyses 3D nuclear landscape recorded super-resolved fluorescence microscopy. Methods 123 (2017) 33-46. DOI 10.1016/j.ymeth.2017.03.013 Volker J. Schmid (2026). nucim: Nucleome Imaging Toolbox. R package version 1.0.13. https://bioimaginggroup.github.io/nucim/
code: @Article{,   title = {Quantitative analyses of the 3D nuclear landscape recorded with super-resolved fluorescence microscopy},   author = {Volker J. Schmid and Marion Cremer and Thomas Cremer},   journal = {Methods},   year = {2017},   volume = {123},   pages = {33-46},   doi = {10.1016/j.ymeth.2017.03.013}, } @Manual{,   title = {{nucim}: Nucleome Imaging Toolbox},   author = {Volker J. Schmid},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 1.0.13},   url = {https://bioimaginggroup.github.io/nucim/}, }

title: Nucleome Imaging Toolbox
text: nucim (Nucleome Imaging Toolbox) R package quantitative analyses 3D nuclear landscape recorded super-resolved fluorescence microscopy.

title: Nucleome Imaging Toolbox
text: stable version available CRAN: Installation take 5 10 seconds. Tested platforms can found . development version available github. development version probably depends development version bioimagetools: may need install additional libraries OS can install nucim. E.g. Ubuntu/Debian systems, please execute: terminal installing nucim.
code: setRepositories(ind=c(1,2)) install.packages(c("nucim")) setRepositories(ind=c(1,2)) install.packages(c("devtools","tiff","EBImage")) devtools::install_github("bioimaginggroup/bioimagetools") devtools::install_github("bioimaginggroup/nucim") sudo apt install libssl-dev libcurl4-openssl-dev libtiff5-dev libfftw3-dev

title: Nucleome Imaging Toolbox
text: Description package basic instructions can found : Volker J. Schmid, Marion Cremer, Thomas Cremer: Quantitative analyses 3D nuclear landscape recorded super-resolved fluorescence microscopy. Methods 123 (2017), p. 33–46. [DOI]

title: Nucleome Imaging Toolbox
text: package developed BioImaging group Department Statistics, cooperation Biocenter, Department Biology II, LMU Munich. Main development implementation: Volker J Schmid Developement workflow: Marion Thomas Cremer Input specific parts: Barbara Hübner, Yolanda Markaki, Jens Popken, Lothar Schermelleh, Daniel Smeets

title: Compute colors in classes distribution for folders — colors.in.classes.folder
text: path Path root folder color1 Image first color color2 Image second color N Maximum number classes type Type spot definition, see details thresh1 Threshold first color image thresh2 Threshold second color image sd1 automatic threshold, : mean(color1)+sd1*sd(color1) sd2 automatic threshold color2 col1 Name color 1 col2 Name color 2 cores Number cores used parallel, cores=1 implies parallelization verbose verbose mode

code: colors.in.classes(   classes,   color1,   color2 = NULL,   mask = array(TRUE, dim(classes)),   N = max(classes, na.rm = TRUE),   type = "tresh",   thresh1 = NULL,   thresh2 = NULL,   sd1 = 2,   sd2 = 2,   col1 = "green",   col2 = "red",   test = FALSE,   plot = TRUE,   beside = TRUE,   ylim = NULL,   verbose = FALSE,   ... )

title: Compute colors in classes distribution — colors.in.classes
text: classes Image classes color1 Image first color color2 Image second color mask Image mask N Maximum number classes type Type spot definition, see details thresh1 Threshold first color image thresh2 Threshold second color image sd1 automatic threshold, : mean(color1)+sd1*sd(color1) sd2 automatic threshold color2 col1 Name color 1 col2 Name color 2 test Compute tests: "Wilcoxon" Wilcoxon rank-sum (Mann-Whitney U), chisq Chi-squared test plot Plot barplots beside logical value. FALSE, columns height portrayed stacked bars, TRUE columns portrayed juxtaposed bars. ylim limits y axis (plot) verbose verbose mode ... additional plotting parameters

title: nucim 1.0.13
text: Minor update.

title: nucim 1.0.12
text: Use inherits().

title: nucim 1.0.11
text: CRAN release: 2021-06-10 Fixed folder change plot_colors..classes.folder(), t_colors..classes.folder() colors..classes.folder(). Fixed barplot_with_interval_23() two classes.

title: nucim 1.0.9
text: CRAN release: 2020-05-29 Fixed folder change plot_classify.folder(). Compatibility R 4.0.0.

title: nucim 1.0.8
text: Workflow vignette revised. Removed bug spots.combined() using voxelsize. Thanks Alexander Rapp, TU Darmstadt.

title: nucim 1.0.7
text: Rescale weights colors..classes intensity method. Weights rescaled [0, 1] robust results. Change intensity-based weighting automatic thresholding default; old version can used thresh1=0, thresh2=0.

title: nucim 1.0.6
text: CRAN release: 2018-10-09 Add check observations colors..classes() small design fixes

title: nucim 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2016-12-05 Finalized manuscript Quantitative analyses 3D nuclear landscape recorded super-resolved fluorescence microscopy (Schmid, Cremer, Cremer)
